health.description: The World Health Organiziation classifies bacon and sausage as carcinogenic to humans
Dairy can increase the risk of prostate cancer by 34%
93% of dioxin exposure comes from eating meat and dairy products

environment.description: Animal agriculture is the world's single greatest contributor to wildlife habitat destruction, species extinction, and ocean dead zones
While fracking consumes as much as 140 billion gallons of fresh water annually in the United States, the farming of animals uses at least 34 trillion gallons of fresh water annually

Between 18% and 51% of all greenhouse gas emissions are directly attributable to livestock respiration, methane, production of animal products, and other relatable sources, compared to 13% from every form of transportation on the planet combined

ethics.description: The accumulation of chicken waste in descriptionory farms commonly result in ammonia levels that cause painful burns to the birds' skin, eyes, and respiratory tracts

Animals are routinely exposed to extreme temperatures during the trip to the slaughterhouse. Mammals must stand in a slurry of urine, feces, and vomit; those who fall and canâ€™t get up may be trampled or suffocate. Approximately 200,000 pigs die on their way to slaughter every year in the United States
Over 95 percent of U.S. land animals killed for food are birds, yet they are exempt from the federal Humane Methods of Slaughter Act and there is no federal law requiring they be handled humanely
